result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey B. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The costs are added to defendant's current payment plan of $150.00 a month.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey B. Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Casey B. Smith in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  State moves to amend count 1 to Misd. - Failure to  Report to County Jail 946.425(1m)(a).   Plea of no contest.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of the amended charge and orders courts costs; DNA surcharge; 30 days county jail with huber to begin no later than June 8, 2015 at 4:30 p.m.  Costs are to be paid at the rate of . Advised of right to preliminary hearing within time limits.  Time limits waived.  PTC set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.
Defendant Casey B. Smith in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recommended a $1000 signature bond with booking.  Court ordered bond as requested.
